meanings.definition: To refresh oneself, especially with food or drink.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, I like to refect with a glass of cold water.
meanings.sent2: It is important to refect after a long day of work to regain energy.
meanings.sent3: I always refect with a snack before starting my homework.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful garden refected my soul like a calm lake.
meanings.sent5: The delicious meal refected in her eyes as she took the first bite.

meanings.definition: To provide food or drink for someone.
meanings.sent1: She kindly refects her guests with homemade cookies.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant will refect all attendees at the event.
meanings.sent3: The generous host continued to refect her guests even after they were full.
meanings.sent4: Her love for cooking refected in every dish she prepared.
meanings.sent5: The caring nurse refected the patients with warm soup on a cold day.
